The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to set fixed interest rates for new loans made on or after July 1, 2006. The applicable rate of interest is 6.8 percent on the unpaid principal balance of the loan, with exceptions for certain types of loans. The interest rates for new loans made on or after July 1, 2006, are set at 7.9 percent for section 428B loans and at the lesser of the weighted average of consolidated loan rates or 8.25 percent for section 428C consolidation loans. The interest rates for new loans made on or after July 1, 2006, are set at 7.9 percent for section 428B loans and at the lesser of the weighted average of consolidated loan rates or 8.25 percent for section 428C consolidation loans. Additionally, the applicable interest rate for loans made under this section before July 1, 2006, is determined under specific sections of the Higher Education Act of 1965. The Higher Education Act of 1965 was amended to include a new interest rate provision for Federal Direct Stafford Loans and Federal Direct Unsubsidized Stafford Loans with a 6.8 percent interest rate for loans disbursed on or after July 1, 2006. The interest rate for Federal Direct PLUS loans disbursed after July 1, 2006 is 7.9 percent on the unpaid balance. For Federal Direct Consolidation loans applied for after the same date, the interest rate is the lesser of the weighted average of consolidated loan rates rounded up to the nearest one-eighth of one percent or 8.25 percent. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to change the dates from 2003 to 2006 for certain sections. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to extend the special allowance provision from July 1, 2003 to a later date. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to extend the special allowance provision for student loans disbursed between January 1, 2000, and July 1, 2006, with specific interest rate conditions outlined. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to extend the special allowance provision for student loans disbursed between January 1, 2000, and July 1, 2006, with specific interest rate conditions outlined. The amendment includes adjustments to various clauses related to PLUS loans, such as substituting percentages and inserting new clauses for limitations on special allowances. For PLUS loans disbursed after July 1, 2006, special allowance will not be paid unless certain conditions are met. The bond equivalent rates of the 3-month commercial paper published by the Federal Reserve System, plus 2.64 percent, must exceed 9.0 percent.
